file_content.text: I'll be certain to include your name in my research documentation... somewhere, at any rate.
I was right! My hypothesis was utterly correct!
Since you left, there have already been reports of Sand People carefully avoiding the local settlements--they now respect our strength, just as I'd thought!
Great!
These fools will probably never appreciate what I've done for them.
Let's get to my reward.
Yes, yes, fine--here. Though participating in my achievement should be reward enough.
Don't I get any gratitude?
Your contribution was important, certainly. You should feel very proud to have helped.
This will be a tremendous boon to my research--I must begin my formal documentation immediately!
Show the Sand People our strength! Make them respect us!
I'm telling you people that we can save lives! Why won't any of you rubes listen to me?
These "Sand People" may be violent, but they have a society and customs. I know ways to make them leave you alone, if you weren't too ignorant to listen!
You'll never stir people to action by berating them.
Insults won't serve you.
A Jedi? Hmph. You're probably right--these fools are a lost cause. But perhaps you will act, even if they will not.
Are you saying that diplomacy with the Sand People is possible?
There's a peaceful solution?
A Jedi? No, I'm afraid the Sand People are no more interested in listening to reason than these backward fools. But perhaps you will!
I'm going to need you to calm down, sir.
Take it easy.
I'll calm down when somebody actually agrees to listen to reason. How about you?
Nobody likes a loudmouth. You've got to play it smooth.
Yelling won't convince anyone.
This is no time for jokes, you--wait. You aren't a local. Perhaps you can actually help this situation.
Let me help you.
Finally, someone smart enough to listen!
Get over yourself.
Anyone who ignores an enlightened voice at the risk of their own safety is a fool. The point cannot be argued.
I've been studying the Sand People for some time and, while their attacks are savage, they are not mindless beasts. They merely respect strength.
Rival Sand People tribes often send warriors into each other's camps to fight ritual challenges and prove their strength.
If someone here--you, perhaps--were to undertake such a ritual challenge, I'm confident that it would earn their respect and end their attacks.
I'm always up for a challenge.
That's a clever idea.
It is good to finally have my work suitably appreciated.
Take this--the Sand People I observed carried a similar object. Plant it in the midst of their camp, and defeat all who come to challenge you.
We will save these dull-minded dregs yet!
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Then leave me to my fruitless task of convincing these morons to save themselves!
We have nothing to discuss.
